94723DCF1B294F229CC0C604B58AB45D.description: Decide which type of function is most appropriate by observing graphed data.

9723746562094085A4F4812DEA65C79B.description: Calculate the line of best fit and interpret the correlation coefficient, r, of a linear fit using technology. Use r to describe the strength of the goodness of fit of the regression. Use the linear function to make predictions and assess how reasonable the prediction is in context.

B2E4E73682BE4C908F4FDE15FDF35673.description: Interpret the slope (predicted rate of change) and the intercept (constant term) of a linear model based on the investigation of the data.

66EE702E8CC24886BEF11ADCB2994E66.description: Represent data on two quantitative variables on a scatter plot and describe how the variables are related.

03150E23EBDD44B0B8C1CC0EF14CBB1F.description: Interpret differences in shape, center, and variability of the distributions based on the investigation, accounting for possible effects of extreme data points (outliers).

7D6F41E2E83544F3A0EA59CD0E7ABD14.description: Use statistics appropriate to the shape of the data distribution to compare and represent center (median and mean) and variability (interquartile range, standard deviation) of two or more distributions by hand and using technology.

F5D921A73BFF4B34830F0665640B9EFC.description: Collect, analyze, and interpret univariate quantitative data to answer statistical investigative questions that compare groups to solve real-life problems; Represent bivariate data on a scatter plot and fit a function to the data to answer statistical questions and solve real-life problems.

7E1B0F0EA20B4037AE201D72BB39BC39.description: Apply the distance formula, midpoint formula, and slope of line segments to solve real-world problems.

3EF6F555DBEF4FFF987D94149EB67351.description: Solve real-life problems involving slope, parallel lines, perpendicular lines, area, and perimeter.

192B993AFD2C4558BB4F05DCB4F54318.description: Solve problems involving distance, midpoint, slope, area, and perimeter to model and explain real-life phenomena

6DF751687960440886A5459D73618212.description: Apply the formulas for the volume of cones, cylinders, and spheres and use them to solve in relevant problems.

61307E4C74464D27B53A2DD8A763EFAF.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to find the distance between two points in a coordinate system in practical, mathematical problems.

44120D2107424179BCDB9B382C1649A4.description: Apply the Pythagorean Theorem to determine unknown side lengths in right triangles within authentic, mathematical problems in two and three dimensions.

AC423DC7E98A44C0B6F4E6F27558BF85.description: Explain a proof of the Pythagorean Theorem and its converse using visual models.

3E038910BA4F420C8925EBD14E8999D4.description: Solve contextual, geometric problems involving the Pythagorean Theorem and the volume of geometric figures to explain real phenomena.

9551BCD83900434AB13EA0957FB9F1E3.description: Compare characteristics of two functions each represented in a different way.

F39FC484FF9F413BAA4760C17361BEA6.description: Use mathematically applicable situations algebraically and graphically to build and interpret geometric sequences as functions whose domain is a subset of the integers.

3B4800095DAD46D1969196A0B82C0ADF.description: Identify the effect on the graph generated by an exponential function when replacing f(x) with f(x) + k, and kf(x), for specific values of k (both positive and negative); find the value of k given the graphs.

138F90146BB64479827ADD0235B6BEE1.description: Graph and analyze the key characteristics of simple exponential functions based on mathematically applicable situations.

CC77CEFCC95147589C15CD359FDFA0D5.description: Use function notation to build and evaluate exponential functions for inputs in their domains and interpret statements that use function notation in terms of a context.

F7DD57C3A3E942B6B738FF08078BCFBA.description: Construct and analyze the graph of an exponential function to explain a mathematically applicable situation for which the graph serves as a model; compare exponential with linear and quadratic functions.

44A30487B6114FDAB436408182DE1CF6.description: Compare characteristics of two functions each represented in a different way.

9DED3ED2D2B14FE397B64215FFA1A160.description: Write a function defined by a quadratic expression in different but equivalent forms to reveal and explain different properties of the function.

4B754EF982A94FD793C5BB4498E29446.description: Estimate, calculate, and interpret the average rate of change of a quadratic function and make comparisons to the average rate of change of linear functions.

DC58ED34FFB54438B854CF7306AAD97B.description: Create quadratic functions in two variables to represent relationships between quantities; graph quadratic functions on the coordinate axes with labels and scales.

CB4A2F29E68E4C2CB67134B50FEA28EE.description: Rewrite a quadratic function representing a mathematically applicable situation to reveal the maximum or minimum value of the function it defines. Explain what the value describes in context.

5715A95C719842479FDA2E8B8CBF4E71.description: Relate the domain and range of a quadratic function to its graph and, where applicable, to the quantitative relationship it describes.

2042046FD3B4473997864084A6A20140.description: Graph and analyze the key characteristics of quadratic functions.

3C30B509BE084E249B3BD0FBCB321367.description: Identify the effect on the graph generated by a quadratic function when replacing f(x) with f(x) + k, kf(x), f(kx), and f(x + k) for specific values of k (both positive and negative); find the value of k given the graphs.

BE022AF842A7411AB6A2C3DF82793371.description: Use function notation to build and evaluate quadratic functions for inputs in their domains and interpret statements that use function notation in terms of a given framework.

2DCF6B7B926E451FA404E7DC06770FAE.description: Construct and interpret quadratic functions from data points to model and explain real-life phenomena; describe key characteristics of the graph of a quadratic function to explain a mathematically applicable situation for which the graph serves as a model.

722CEBCD9C534710962546785C5BB625.description: Analyze the difference between linear functions and nonlinear functions by informally analyzing the graphs of various parent functions (linear, quadratic, exponential, absolute value, square root, and cube root parent curves).

7AB83DE4C29244788AA2B41440DF4AE5.description: Use function notation to build and evaluate linear functions for inputs in their domains and interpret statements that use function notation in terms of a mathematical framework.

E0E0EA11DBEE45E1B0F9E2185996CA2D.description: Relate the domain and range of a linear function to its graph and, where applicable, to the quantitative relationship it describes. Use formal interval and set notation to describe the domain and range of linear functions.

C96A1F09D479449699C22BD194B42FAC.description: Construct and interpret the graph of a linear function that models real-life phenomena and represent key characteristics of the graph using formal notation.

7DB3D18FFB9543769AD04E63FE5E619B.description: Use mathematically applicable situations algebraically and graphically to build and interpret arithmetic sequences as functions whose domain is a subset of the integers.

7BB4E76C33E549F683E0AA053E62A3D7.description: Construct and interpret arithmetic sequences as functions, algebraically and graphically, to model and explain real-life phenomena. Use formal notation to represent linear functions and the key characteristics of graphs of linear functions, and informally compare linear and non-linear functions using parent graphs.

B28A9805EA1541C2846395F6EE90C59E.description: Create and compare the equations of two lines that are either parallel to each other, perpendicular to each other, or neither parallel nor perpendicular.

E0A1E75A2F1149648252D0DCB530FFEA.description: Analyze and solve systems of two linear equations in two variables algebraically to find exact solutions.

AA27F3D92A854D26889FC4B77BC3615A.description: Show and explain that solutions to a system of two linear equations in two variables correspond to points of intersection of their graphs, because the points of intersection satisfy both equations simultaneously.

FD8FE5ACCBAC451A9470D149405645F5.description: Interpret and solve relevant mathematical problems leading to two linear equations in two variables.

AD5D737EF54B45748B620E19FF89AB17.description: Justify and use various strategies to solve systems of linear equations to model and explain realistic phenomena.

F69A9BF43AF94425AA434AE5F7FD8946.description: Use appropriate graphical displays from data distributions involving lines of best fit to draw informal inferences and answer the statistical investigative question posed in an unbiased statistical study.

B119171BEF1A45E990E30871A7534F60.description: Explain the meaning of the predicted slope (rate of change) and the predicted intercept (constant term) of a linear model in the context of the data.

94BD1546DB89464F9A3AF2F013088AE8.description: Use the equation of a linear model to solve problems in the context of bivariate measurement data, interpreting the slope and intercepts.

8C82B6A4ACAD4CE68046A4B61FEDD1AC.description: Show that straight lines are widely used to model relationships between two quantitative variables. For scatter plots that suggest a linear association, visually fit a straight line, and informally assess the model fit by judging the closeness of the data points to the line of best fit.

E84C4520E8DB4490BB4AD52B58556D5F.description: Solve practical, linear problems involving situations using bivariate quantitative data.

308B7BA0B4704715857D23EBD25C056D.description: Graph and analyze linear functions expressed in various algebraic forms and show key characteristics of the graph to describe applicable situations.

291700C199D741F0AE161C5D6DE742B3.description: Explain the meaning of the rate of change and initial value of a linear function in terms of the situation it models, and in terms of its graph or a table of values.

7AFA899410ED4AF68B0953F6BAF002DA.description: Construct a function to model a linear relationship between two quantities. Determine the rate of change and initial value of the function from a description of a relationship or from two (x,y) values, including reading these from a table or from a graph.

BF31F86EBE134C179E808D46B670537E.description: Write a linear function defined by an expression in different but equivalent forms to reveal and explain different properties of the function.

EA4E58673A1F4933A1A04304D0B764CA.description: Compare properties (rate of change and initial value) of two functions used to model an authentic situation each represented in a different way (algebraically, graphically, numerically in tables, or by verbal descriptions).

88D4AFA7628F438BB111EACB800A9EA9.description: Relate the domain of a linear function to its graph and where applicable to the quantitative relationship it describes.

BB042E2774654196A52FEA8BA5DF848D.description: Within realistic situations, identify and describe examples of functions that are linear or nonlinear. Sketch a graph that exhibits the qualitative features of a function that has been described verbally.

F5CC313368E34459A051F1A180A0E627.description: Show and explain that a function is a rule that assigns to each input exactly one output.

7FA1C07F181A46D4A7335A3E0D1CA7B7.description: Describe the properties of functions to define, evaluate, and compare relationships, and use functions and graphs of functions to model and explain real phenomena.

7075E99136154FAEAF5103961D477099.description: Represent constraints by exponential equations and interpret data points as possible or not possible in a modeling environment.

3FFD5858A6604356AA34F27393770765.description: Create exponential equations in two variables to represent relationships between quantities, including in mathematically applicable situations; graph equations on coordinate axes with labels and scales.

AB69655E314B451E87BEE67BD92DB484.description: Create exponential equations in one variable and use them to solve problems, including mathematically applicable situations.

5FF5D11E65194501BC2D31219D9FE261.description: Interpret exponential expressions and parts of an exponential expression that represent a quantity in terms of its framework.

54E3E2583E4649A3BBEA730EC31DA877.description: Create and analyze exponential expressions and equations to represent and model real-life phenomena; solve exponential equations in mathematically applicable situations.

61CB1F5B17824E229DBB17FEBBDE02B0.description: Represent constraints by quadratic equations and interpret data points as possible or not possible in a modeling framework.

A0D8B666C73B468B8AAFE75F97B87596.description: Create and solve quadratic equations in one variable and explain the solution in the framework of applicable phenomena.

997AF64BC09545EE8BDE2CAD5B32B3C6.description: Fluently choose and produce an equivalent form of a quadratic expression to reveal and explain properties of the quantity represented by the expression.

F5560BF2221D4700B6F52F71AB48F25A.description: Interpret quadratic expressions and parts of a quadratic expression that represent a quantity in terms of its context.

2F8D19957E16463F8D7B4F3B6D9D2E54.description: Build quadratic expressions and equations to represent and model real-life phenomena; solve quadratic equations in mathematically applicable situations.

6610EEC1030C433D9783BB003993E27C.description: Solve systems of linear inequalities by graphing, including systems representing a mathematically applicable situation.

144E1CBC7A18446195AA058D14BD1B85.description: Represent constraints of linear inequalities and interpret data points as possible or not possible.

2D4604D61FDD47BBB3C61CFF33DEC722.description: Create and solve linear inequalities in two variables to represent relationships between quantities including mathematically applicable situations; graph inequalities on coordinate axes with labels and scales.

89449F7FA85E4EC1A347722F5ECA6430.description: Create, analyze, and solve linear inequalities in two variables and systems of linear inequalities to model real-life phenomena.

E6C0C7C470374AD49603B8B2AF6F7223.description: Show and explain that the graph of an equation representing an applicable situation in two variables is the set of all its solutions plotted in the coordinate plane.

037C090589AE4AD08A2D168CEA3A73CF.description: Use the equation y = mx (proportional) for a line through the origin to derive the equation y = mx + b (non-proportional) for a line intersecting the vertical axis at b.

25B85FCEAA1E4D1485D696D13896C33D.description: Show and explain the connections between proportional and non-proportional relationships, lines, and linear equations; create and interpret graphical mathematical models and use the graphical, mathematical model to explain real phenomena represented in the graph.

07F5BA2EC3B84352AEC1818F46B42103.description: Use algebraic reasoning to fluently manipulate linear and literal equations expressed in various forms to solve relevant, mathematical problems.

FF44C44FDE1A4C7DBC74AF3F815323E6.description: Solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable with coefficients represented by letters and explain the solution based on the contextual, mathematical situation.

5C2E855A22FF4C0CBE25F385FCC3A371.description: Using algebraic properties and the properties of real numbers, justify the steps of a one-solution equation or inequality.

FCDA6387F2AE4C6E9E0E938256ED7B18.description: Create and solve linear equations and inequalities in one variable within a relevant application.

D9BCFA3D5C1A464EB40BD3D00B98E752.description: Describe and solve linear equations in one variable with one solution (x = a), infinitely many solutions (a = a), or no solutions (a = b). Show which of these possibilities is the case by successively transforming the given equation into simpler forms, until an equivalent equation of the form x = a, a = a, or a = b results (where a and b are different numbers).

2800976EC4E14644BFFFAAAFA5D9A60D.description: Interpret expressions and parts of an expression, in context, by utilizing formulas or expressions with multiple terms and/or factors.

7B6B5D90007748849A905E29284EAED0.description: Create and interpret expressions within relevant situations. Create, interpret, and solve linear equations and linear inequalities in one variable to model and explain real phenomena.

642E4324AAA142B9A3A234F67F0FDB7F.description: Using numerical reasoning, show and explain that the sum or product of rational numbers is rational, the sum of a rational number and an irrational number is irrational, and the product of a nonzero rational number and an irrational number is irrational.

D4069FC8E1374B67A35217FE2C1E863F.description: Rewrite algebraic and numeric expressions involving radicals.

2A34D0A5A95141BBBAF72CF09B83D7BC.description: Investigate rational and irrational numbers and rewrite expressions involving square roots and cube roots.

1E2BDF1239114998AC64EB7D1D5C4CD8.description: Add, subtract, multiply and divide numbers expressed in scientific notation, including problems where both decimal and scientific notation are used. Interpret scientific notation that has been generated by technology (e.g., calculators or online technology tools).

CDB3FDBE19154DDCBB7F9135366A0955.description: Use numbers expressed in scientific notation to estimate very large or very small quantities, and to express how many times as much one is than the other.

BA5DCB980C424F72A0B532F3D9503E15.description:
Use square root and cube root symbols to represent solutions to equations. Recognize that x^ 2
 = p (where p is a positive rational number and |x| ≤ 25) has two solutions and x^3
 = p (where p is a negative or positive rational number and |x| ≤ 10) has one solution. Evaluate square roots of perfect squares ≤ 625 and cube roots of perfect cubes ≥ -1000 and ≤ 1000.

E4FA652A6C3747BC82A027DCC237F8FE.description: Apply the properties of integer exponents to generate equivalent numerical expressions.

C3732509E1304B63B608C33CD42B1F06.description: Solve problems involving radicals and integer exponents including relevant application situations; apply place value understanding with scientific notation and use scientific notation to explain real phenomena.

AF0FE3B9E3A24EE0911A9DAB50F4D4DF.description: Approximate irrational numbers to compare the size of irrational numbers, locate them approximately on a number line, and estimate the value of expressions.

0A5C4A14493D4AB9A80B34C407DC7540.description: Distinguish between rational and irrational numbers using decimal expansion. Convert a decimal expansion which repeats eventually into a rational number.

9660E40C7E7946A78A8C3896545E0C84.description: Solve problems involving irrational numbers and rational approximations of irrational numbers to explain realistic applications.

A0BFA117191B4120A387F79AA9C6ABDD.description: Define appropriate quantities for the purpose of descriptive modeling.

3D652C0D533A4E608420C61E8E8E23B6.description: Use various mathematical representations and structures with this information to represent and solve real-life problems.

8949C5FEDBDA44AFAA07639A503CD16A.description: Use units of measure (linear, area, capacity, rates, and time) as a way to make sense of conceptual problems; identify, use, and record appropriate units of measure within the given framework, within data displays, and on graphs; convert units and rates using proportional reasoning given a conversion factor; use units within multi-step problems and formulas; interpret units of input and resulting units of output.

D7934A7B6F9147688FD8ED2AB23EF4B8.description: Create mathematical models to explain phenomena that exist in the natural sciences, social sciences, liberal arts, fine and performing arts, and/or humanities domains.

AE4E54086A8D4B8089BA87731EA742B8.description: Explain applicable, mathematical problems using a mathematical model.

EE7FB9ACA7454D8083478F8C2EB925B6.description: Apply mathematics to real-life situations; model real-life phenomena using mathematics.

8C82341EB94C457FA630AFB91E3FD075.description: Look for and express regularity in repeated reasoning.

036DC0272F664604B763D203A5832CAD.description: Look for and make use of structure.

326B3ECADFC64068BCB23D07096B2EA8.description: Construct viable arguments and critique the reasoning of others.

215D4AB78D9E484B9A11C8201C1268C4.description: Make sense of problems and persevere in solving them.

52D8BBF708F44F909ED7A5C68BA8F11E.description: Display perseverance and patience in problem-solving. Demonstrate skills and strategies needed to succeed in mathematics, including critical thinking, reasoning, and effective collaboration and expression. Seek help and apply feedback. Set and monitor goals.
